relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Very small but controls most of the parties.
Ski club is the most popular and most sports are club sports.
People really like to steal construction signs.
People party or go down by the lake when it is warm out.
Food is terrible except in Simpson Dining Hall.
You get to know people pretty well but people are not out going like in the Midwest.
Classes are a bit harder than they seem but very manageable.

Make sure you are really willing to live in a small town far from any large town (Montreal is 1.5 hrs away but impossible to get to). If you are out of state, don't even apply! They give bad scholarship and it is over priced.

Not a great place to go unless you like small towns and folksy people. Most of the classes are far away from the dorms (15-20 mins to walk to classes) and the food isn't very good. Everything is also highly over priced.
pageTitle: University of Vermont (UVM) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {453188=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 436408=A lot of freshman get placed into triples, but over the next year or so (2015/2016), they are building brand new freshman dorms. The dorms in general are nicer than many schools I've visited. Living in the dorms is a great way to meet new people and make friends. The RAs do a good job in building community in each floor. As to the niceness of the residence hall, the Honors College has the nicest dorms, and then after that, the halls on the Redstone Campus are pretty nice.}

textAfterTable: Will learn a lot This school is amazing, and not only for the great classes and professors they have- they are one of the most green campuses in the country. You don't only learn in your classes, you learn life skills like recycling. Also, UVM is not the kind of school that teaches to the tests- it's not what you think, it's HOW you think. Here you learn critical thinking skills. to help you in whatever career you choose. Login to rate or flag the reviews Suzanne from New York 08/08/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 13 people found this review useful. 3 of 94 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Basically everyone. UVM has a really laid back atmosphere that is very accepting of all different types of people. There are groups for everyone! There are a lot of different types of people on campus and since the student body is so large, you'll definitely find people with similar interests. Tips for prospective
